title: Scoreless Society
outcome: Oksana Lintz and Lenart Kova discover a deep flaw in the BCI that cannot be patched. They decide to fully disable scoring, turning Stenograd into a society without behavioral scores for the first time in years. Citizens adapt to life without digital rankings, leading to unexpected social order and self-organization, but new tensions and uncertainties also arise. Meanwhile, the origins of Halden’s final fatal update are uncovered, reframing his death as a calculated act to reveal the system’s fundamental weakness.

events.description: Oksana Lintz and Lenart Kova discover a critical, unresolvable flaw in the BCI architecture following intense citizen scrutiny during the amnesty forums.
After secret deliberations, Lintz and Kova decide to fully disable all BCI scoring and compliance triggers, leaving only minimal identity checks.
Residents wake up to a scoreless society. Access to work, housing, and transit now operates on a first-come, first-served basis, creating shock and rapid, improvised new routines.

Neighborhoods rapidly organize self-governance, forming ad hoc assemblies to resolve disputes and allocate resources in the absence of BCI direction. Directorate threatens to intervene but struggles to justify new controls.
Analysis of Halden's sealed system logs from January 2025 reveals he planned for a 'total failure' scenario, reframing his death as a deliberate act to expose and end Stenograd’s automated rule.
